title: Farewell, Old Website!
post:
With changes to Replit's hosting at the beginning of January 2024, this site will be unable to fully operate as is. To put it simply, I hosted the backend for this site on Replit, which dealt with features like logging in, the Hivezine, and the host queue. I have, however, been slowly migrating and remaking the Gaehive website to be better, cleaner, and to no longer rely on Replit. Ver2 of the Gaehive Website will release sometime in the first half of 2024 (probably lol) and will use Supabase for features like the Hivezine and host queue. I'll keep y'all updated on the Gaehive Studio!

To keep the legacy of this version alive, I have moved much of the stored data to a static, non-server, site, allowing for this site to be read-only!
You can find this version at https://gaehive-legacy.vercel.app/

title: Movie Recommendation! - Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
post: <h3> Marcel the Shell with Shoes on </h3> This is a super cute movie about a 1-inch-tall shell named Marcel, and his journey to find the rest of his family. <br> Marcel used to live with a bunch of other members of a community, until one day they disappeared. Now Marcel lives with only his Grandma in a house that is an Air B&B. None of the guests notice Marcel - until an amateur film maker comes along, and decides to make a documentary about Marcel.  You get to see Marcel living everyday parts of his life, telling stories, and eventually looking for his family. I really enjoyed the style of the movie, which is modeled as a sort of documentary, but also includes stop motion and puppetry in order to bring Marcel and other characters to life. <br> The movie is rated PG, is 1.5 hours long, and you can find where to watch it   <a href="https://www.google.com/search?q=watch+marcel+the+shell+with+shoes+on&rlz=1CAMFAZ_enUS986US986&oq=mar&aqs=chrome.0.69i59j69i57j69i59j69i64j69i59j69i61j69i60j69i61.1161j0j7&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&si=ACFMAn_SS78MEibKCAWlYss0xRJ_xMTuplOxPXIKGH46gujQMmuDAhq317pRSSPzNWK7hYIKWRpvIKVsolWRI6dZzfQjHUslrlioeZBDQMl66i2Y2nOG_iI1PzO0kfsUVGlK9ohC_9D-ek7YbSQVs1TO5xdAWoBfVqlaxa4_WaTuLSeolsrRb4hwOlhhYCJhujqedkHzaoTj&ictx=1&ved=2ahUKEwi175aqgKGBAxVBj4kEHcsDDBAQyNoBKAB6BAgREAA"> here </a>   <h4> tldr : Y'all should really watch this movie it's super good and really wholesome </h4>

title: Witherbloom Academy: Episode 6
Witherbloom Academy: Weekly Narritive poetry with Angelo (Ep: 5)
post:
<center><b>A Fortress of Art</b></center><br> <br> This place it seems to me
<br> Must be a dream within a dream
<br> For nothing this perfect is true
<br> It seems,
<br> Tis a fortress of art And self honesty
<br> That home never offered me.
<br> But sometimes..
<br> I worry
<br> About the consequences
<br> Of worlds
<br> Aligned <br> <br>-John <br><br><br> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br><br> <b><u>(AU):</u><i> Thank you for reading this post, i really appreciate it. New entries coming Sundays and Wednesdays. If you missed my last one, you can always check out my scratch studio with a full library of all past entries { https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/885252792/ } or you can just check out the scratch project for this entry, which has footnotes and explanations for this entry, as well as its relations to past and future episodes { https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/884278718/ }. And as always, thank you for your time. :pride::heart::trans:

title: Witherbloom Acadmey, Bi-weekly Narrative poetry with Ink (Ep: 4)
post:
<center><b>Teedle-dee. tweedle-dee</b></center> <br> <br> <br> <br> teedle-dee, tweedle dee <br> Here I sing wild and free <br> I imagine the sea in my glass <br> Teedle-dee, tweedle-doo <br> So I sit next to you <br> And we look at the clouds fade away. <br> <br> Tweedle dee teedee-dum <br> And I twidale my thumbs <br> As I sit and I whistle awhile <br> <br> I say “Teedle dee tweedle dee <br> few folks care about me how in <br> beautiful verse I contrive <br> but someday far away <br> I’ll be rich, and have fame <br> and they’ll regret their choices of yore” <br> <br> -Theodore
 <br><br><br> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br><br> <b><u>(AU):</u><i> Thank you for reading this post, i really appreciate it. New entries coming Sundays and Wednesdays. If you missed my last one, you can always check out my scratch  studio with a full library of all past entries { https://scratch.mit.edu/studios/33694307/ } or you can just check out the scratch project for this entry, which has footnotes and explanations for this entry, as well as its relations to past and future episodes { https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/884278718/ }. And as always, thank you for your time. :pride::heart::trans:

title: Witherbloom Acadmey, Bi-weekly Narrative poetry with Ink (Ep: 3)
post:
<b><center>Maurice </center> </b><br> <br>Can I debate
<br> My right to debate?
<br> Clean slate
<br> Full plate
<br> Stopped feeling great awhile ago.
<br> Do we have the right to ignorance? <br> Should we?
<br> <br> Should we be allowed the decreasing and decreasing deniability that we have
<br> While we still have it?
<br> Im tired of thoughts, I just want.. <br> silence. <br><br><br> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br><br> <b><u>(AU):</u><i> Thank you for reading this post, i really appreciate it (I’m so sorry I was late this week). New entries will continue to come Sundays and Wednesdays. If you missed my last one, you can always check out my scratch studio with  a full library of all past entries { https://scratch.mit.edu/studios/33694307/ } or you can just check out the scratch project for this entry, which has footnotes and explanations for this entry, as well as its relations to past and future episodes { https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/883603515/ }(which will be added tomorrow). title: Witherbloom Academy (bi-weekly narrative poetry with Ink) ep: 2
post: <center><b>Small shards of life</b></center><br> <br> Little pockets of happy <br>Floral king of life <br> No matter what they say to us <br> We know our lives are rife <br> With lust and colour <br> The moment we've glee, they’re in a dither. <br> <br> Give us a chance <br> To have love and romance <br> Yes, we are young <br> But our lungs breathe the air that you breathe <br> Our hearts feel the things that you feel. <br> We may be immature but <br> A rose by any other name would smell as sweet <br> Isn't love entitled to such? <br> <br> So I pick flowers. <br> While the hours <br> Away <br> Day to day <br> Take me away <br> To a place <br> Where I can build a bouquet <br> for the one l love. <br> <br> Let me exchange my turtle doves. <br> <br> -William <br><br><br> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br><br> <b><u>(AU):</u><i> Thank you for reading this post, i really appreciate it, new entries will continue to come Sundays and Wednesdays. If you missed my last one, you can always check out my scratch studio with a full library of all past entries { https://scratch.mit.edu/studios/33694307/ } or you can just check out the scratch project for this entry, which has footnotes and explanations for this entry, as well as its relations to past and future episodes { https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/882279350/ }. title: See y'all around!     👋
post: <h2>Hiya frens! </h2>With the summer coming to an end, so has my activity on Scratch. With this, there are a couple things I'd like to say, as I am heading away for a while again.<br><br><b>For one, taking care of the Hivezine:</b><br> I'd like to remind you all that Writers, and Managers, have the ability to remove (and add) Writers and their posts on the Hivezine.  Of course, all posts are posted on Scratch, so they have to pass through Scratch's filter, however, if there is a post that you, as a Writer or Manager, feel breaks Scratch or Gaehive Guidelines, please delete the post by clicking the title of the post, and clicking the small delete button in the top right. If it breaks Community Guidelines, make sure you report the comment, which you can find in <a href="https://scratch.mit.edu/studios/33586934/comments">this studio</a>.  If you're neither a Writer or a Manager, I'd encourage you to reach out to one if you feel a post does not belong here.<br><br>I also leave it up to you Writers, and especially Managers, whether a Writer is no longer fit for the position. If you feel a Writer should be removed, please do so by clicking the "Edit Writers" button on the Hivezine homepage. Once their login expires two weeks after their most recent login, they will lose Hivezine access.<br> If there are any users who you think would make a great Writer, you can also add them!<br><br><b>The Home page:</b><br>Writers and Managers can pin posts to the homepage by clicking on the post and clicking the small pin button in the top right. Please only pin posts if they are important studio news or announcements!<br><br><b>The Manager page:</b><br>The managers page is pretty straightforward;  If we promote new managers, or a current one leaves/becomes inactive, you Managers can add and remove them by clicking the "Edit Managers" button.<br><br><b>Overall:</b><br>Please leave any feedback, questions, ideas, or bug reports by clicking the "feedback" button on the sidebar. I'll check there every so often.

title: Witherbloom Academy (bi-weekly narrative poetry with Ink) ep: 1
post: <center><b>Sweet Forsaken Remedy <br> Mario and Amity </b></center><br><br> I can’t believe she got in this school <br><br><i>You know her grandfather is on the school board</i><br><br> Yeah, but still…. <br><br><i>They say she’s quite bright.. </i></center><br><br> I dont care what <u> they</u> say. She’s.. that is to say.. well- Witherbloom’s been an all-boys school for years. Don’t you think it’s  a bit distracting from our studies?<br><br><i> .. Do you think that?</i><br><br> No, i just figured the board might. <br><br><i>Her grandfather was the deciding vote..</i><br><br>Oh. <br><br><br> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br><br> <b><u>(AU):</u><i> Thank you for reading this post, i really appreciate it, new entries will continue to come  Sundays and Wednesdays. title: ione's archive - wallflower

title: Witherbloom academy: Pilot (weekly narrative poetry from ink)
post: <center> <b> Witherbloom Academy <b/> </center> <br> <br> See dramatic life so fair <br> A scrap of sunshine, ever rare <br> The dampened air is full of gloom <br> Tis the way of Witherbloom. <br> <br> Here where art and sadness wed <br> Sleep at desks and not your bed <br> Ink in drinking water plume <br> Smell of coffee; Witherbloom. <br> <br>Your stern forbearers on the walls <br Of the grand and gothic halls <br> On your schedule barley room <br> To amuse at Witherbloom. <br> <br> But if you meet someone at brake <br> And they keep you wide awake <br> Make your spirits soar anew <br> Still romance at Witherbloom.

title: Quick Introduction
post: Hello Readers! I’m Leila, a gender-fluid, pan human. I recently joined the Gaehive about 2 weeks ago. My pronouns are flexible. Some of the hobbies I enjoy are Swimming, cooking, drawing, talking and singing. I am an Aquarius and INTJ -T.  I plan to write updates on the LBGTQ+ community and other things that I’m still pending on.  If you have any questions. let me know on my profile. See you in the next post!

title: Smol introduction (because everyone else is doing it)
post: Hi! I’m Ink! (I have other names and stuff but these are subject to change) My pronouns are they/he/xe and I am quite the queerio if i do say so myself :nails: . I enjoy writing poetry, reading, antiquing, comics, and drawing. I am flux between libramasc and agender. I am achillean. My Myers-Briggs personality type is INFP-T (or the meditator) and I am a cancer. I am also agnostic (god is just watching the world burn lol). I plan on posting fun science facts and poetry. Some of the comics i enjoy are: My dictator boyfriend (on webtoon), Heir’s Game (on webtoon), Love from Beyond War (on webtoon) and the Adventures of God (on webtoon) these all have queer and disability representation and are medium and or light (depending on the comic) on swearing but i love them all. I also founded the Transmasc Locker Room (or TMLR) which is a very fun place, you should check it out https://scratch.mit.edu/studios/33606718/ . If you have questions about any of these things please ask on my profile page. Thanks for your time :)

title: Being Considerate When Posting
post: When commenting posts over in the Hivezine Studio, please make sure that there are no other users currently writing a post.<br>If you create a post before they complete, they'll have to create a new comment. Let's be considerate of our fellow writers :happy:<br><br>Thanks!

title: History of Pride Flags 1 :pride: Lesbian
post:
The lesbian flag is one of the oldest pride flags we have. It's a very common identity with a lot of culture behind it, and that culture goes hand and hand with the flag, which has changed a lot over the past 25 years. Here's a timeline of the lesbian flag, then to now!<br><br><center>:pride:1999:pride:<br><br> <a href="https://imgbb.com/"><img src="https://i.ibb.co/GQ6pLFK/Screen-Shot-2023-08-07-at-11-54-12-AM.png" alt="Screen-Shot-2023-08-07-at-11-54-12-AM" border="0"></a></center><br><br>  The first recorded lesbian flag was made in 1999 by Sean Campbell, a gay artist. It looks completely different from the modern lesbian pride flags. Called the Labrys flag after the axe, it was centered around symbolism in shapes rather than color, most notably the black triangle that represents feminism and lesbianism. <br><br>The Labrys Lesbian pride flag died a very quick death. Many lesbians were averse to the idea of using a pride flag that was made by a man. Additionally, the black triangle is a reclaimed symbol from Nazi Germany, who categorized certain people (including lesbians) with a black triangle. It was also adopted by TERF's and the anti-butch, so it was mostly deserted. In the early 2010s, a new, possibly more controversial flag surfaced.<center><br><br>:pride:2010:pride:<br><br> <a href="https://ibb.co/SJhJn1s"><img src="https://i.ibb.co/M9Y9Vj2/Screen-Shot-2023-08-07-at-11-54-35-AM.png" alt="Screen-Shot-2023-08-07-at-11-54-35-AM" border="0"></a> </center> <br><br>The lipstick lesbian pride flag is still sometimes used today. It was made by  Natalie McCray and was the main lesbian flag for about a decade. Known as the "lipstick lesbian" or "pink lesbian" flag, it was almost if not entirely exclusively representing "femme" lesbians, and ones who fit a very specific idea of lesbian femininity. This did not sit well with other lesbians, and for this reason, it stopped being the socially acceptable lesbian pride flag. <br><center><br>:pride:2018:pride:<br><br><a href="https://imgbb.com/"><img src="https://i.ibb.co/hdwPwDN/Screen-Shot-2023-08-07-at-11-55-37-AM.png" alt="Screen-Shot-2023-08-07-at-11-55-37-AM" border="0"></a>
<br><a href="https://imgbb.com/"><img src="https://i.ibb.co/9nKKT4m/Screen-Shot-2023-08-07-at-12-03-12-PM.png" alt="Screen-Shot-2023-08-07-at-12-03-12-PM" border="0"></a></center> A nonbinary lesbian named Emily Gwen created the sunset lesbian flag in 2018. It is, to this day, the most widely used lesbian flag. Each of its 7 colors has a meaning to the entire lesbian community, including colors representing gender nonconformity and a unique relationship to womanhood. You'll more commonly see the 5-color version of this flag, which is just a simplified version for easier use in design. They're both considered valid versions of the sunset lesbian flag.  <br><center><br>:pride:Ending Notes:pride:<br></center><br>After almost 25 years, there is still no official lesbian flag. In addition to the mainstream flags discussed in this article, there are also a few other flags, including the sun lesbian and moon lesbian flags, ones made for specific use by nonbinary or trans lesbians, and others.  Queer flags are about as straightforward as the communities they represent (which is to say- they're not) so always make sure to ask questions about a flag before using it and be respectful to the rest of your community! (I may repost if the flags decide to be annoying and not work.)<br><br>-Moss

title: ione's poems 001 - rebel girl
post: someone comes home <br>and i know it's my rebel girl<br>wonder where she went tonight<br>if i asked her, would she mind?<br> soul sister, best friend, now i'm kinda bored<br>driving me insane, i just want a little more.<br><br>we're almost the same,<br>me and my rebel girl<br>she can be a rebel<br>but i wish she was mine<br>soul sister, best friend, getting kinda bored<br>won't you be my girl? stay a little more? :frog:

title: poetry
post: her eyes sparkle, <br> like a thousand stars. <br> her smile is comforting, <br> as a kitten’s purr. <br> her heart is strong, <br> full of love and passion. <br> Oh, I long to be like her, <br> the least I can do is be her lover.

title: Policy Notice
post: A new policy has been added to the description. It reads: "For every inappropriate comment made by a studio member (trolls' comments don’t count), I will turn off the comments for 5 minutes in the middle of the day."  The managers have stated that they have not decided whether the new policy is permanent.

title: First VOCALOID Article
post: Hello, and welcome to Hivezine's VOCALOID section! Since this is our first article, I'll give you an introduction. I'm Lyran, and I use any pronouns except he/him. In this section, I will discuss everything related to VOCALOID.<br>Today, we will talk about a VOCALOID classic, "The World is Mine." The song was written by ryo and sung by Hatsune Miku. It was released on May 31, 2008, and has become one of the most well-known VOCALOID songs.<br> The song is about a girl who calls herself a "princess." She sings about her struggles in trying to get a boy to notice her. She wants him to give her everything she wants. At the end of the song, he pulls her out of the path of an oncoming vehicle, thus completing her struggle.<br>I hope you enjoyed my first ever Hivezine article! If you have any feedback, you can always contact me on my Scratch profile, <a href="https://scratch.mit.edu/users/IatetocIass/" target="_blank">@IatetocIass.</a>

title: Welcome to the Gaehive Website! :pride:
post: Hey everyone!<br>Welcome (finally lol) to the Gaehive Website!!<br>I've put <i>a lot</i> of time and effort into this site, so I hope y'all like it!<br><br>If you're not sure where to start, click the "sign in" button over in the sidebar! You'll see some cool things once you're signed in, like Hivezine post reactions!<br><br> If you're a manger or a writer,  you'll also see some cool things, like the ability to create posts on the Hivezine (go on, try it out!), and you managers can also take advantage of the host queue built into the manager page.<br><br>There's a few bits of documentation around the site, like how you can format your Hivezine posts, but you can always ask me on my profile or in the Hivezine Studio if you have any questions,  or feedback!<br><br>Hope you like it! :cool: <br><br><br><sub>psst...there's also some easter eggs hidden around the site...hope you enjoy looking for them!</sub>
